skill.name: linear-projects-read
skill.description: List and get Linear projects via CLI (read-only operations)
skill.summary: List and get Linear projects via CLI (read-only operations)
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: This is a read-only Linear integration skill. The static analyzer incorrectly flagged documentation and metadata as security vulnerabilities. All 47 detected patterns are false positives: documentation URLs (not network exfil), standard .env configuration patterns (not sensitive exposure), bash command examples (not shell execution), and text strings misidentified as weak cryptography. The skill makes authenticated read-only API calls to Linear's official servers with no malicious behavior.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple Linear projects requires context switching and manual searching. This skill provides instant access to list and retrieve project information directly from your CLI. Access project details, filter by status or lead, and retrieve specific projects without leaving your workflow.
actual_capabilities: List all Linear projects with filtering options
Filter projects by status (planned, started, paused, completed, canceled)
Filter projects by project lead name
Retrieve specific project details by name or ID
Output results as JSON or formatted table
limitations: Requires LINEAR_API_KEY environment variable or .env file
Read-only operations - cannot create, update, or delete projects
Partial name matching is case-insensitive only

use_cases.title: Review active projects
use_cases.description: Quickly review all started projects with their leads to track team progress.

use_cases.title: Find project details
use_cases.description: Look up project information by name to understand context before starting work.

use_cases.title: Audit project status
use_cases.description: Generate filtered project lists to prepare for sprint planning meetings.

prompt_templates.title: List recent projects
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to see all projects
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the list-projects command to show all Linear projects.

prompt_templates.title: Filter by status
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need active projects only
prompt_templates.prompt: List all projects with status started using the list-projects command.

prompt_templates.title: Find project by name
prompt_templates.scenario: When you know the project name
prompt_templates.prompt: Get details for the project named Mount Vernon using the get-project command.

prompt_templates.title: Export as JSON
prompt_templates.prompt: List the 10 most recent started projects and output the results as JSON.

output_examples.input: List all started projects with their leads
output: Project: Website Redesign | Status: Started | Lead: Sarah Chen
Project: Mobile App v2 | Status: Started | Lead: James Wilson
Project: API Integration | Status: Started | Lead: Alex Rivera

output_examples.input: Get details for Mount Vernon project
output: Description: Quarterly planning and tracking project

output_examples.input: List completed projects from last month
output: Project: Legacy Migration | Status: Completed | Lead: Thomas Jefferson
Project: Documentation Update | Status: Completed | Lead: James Madison
Project: Security Audit | Status: Completed | Lead: Alexander Hamilton

best_practices: Store your LINEAR_API_KEY securely in environment variables rather than in code
Use the --json flag when you need to process project data programmatically
Combine filters like --status and --lead to narrow down results quickly
anti_patterns: Do not re-summarize or reformat table output that is already visible to the user
Do not attempt to create or modify projects with this read-only skill
Do not share your LINEAR_API_KEY in logs, error messages, or with others

faq.question: Which AI tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool can invoke the list-projects and get-project commands.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for Linear API?
faq.answer: Linear API has standard rate limits. The skill defaults to 25 results to avoid hitting limits. Use --limit to adjust.

faq.question: How do I set up the Linear API key?
faq.answer: Generate a Personal API key from Linear Settings > API. Set it as LINEAR_API_KEY in your environment or .env file.

faq.question: Is my project data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads data from Linear using your authenticated API key. No data is written or modified.

faq.question: Why am I seeing authentication errors?
faq.answer: Check that LINEAR_API_KEY is set correctly in your environment. Verify the key has read permissions in Linear settings.

faq.question: How does this compare to Linear web interface?
faq.answer: This skill provides CLI access for faster workflows. The web interface offers more advanced filtering and editing capabilities.
